page.title: 01Glen Rinnes
page.content: This block includes the summit Ben Rinnes Scurran of Lochtelavdoch 840m. Ben Rinnes is the highest hill in Moray District and is a notable landmark from the Moray Firth coast and sea. Alongside the B9009 and below the peak of Ben Rinnes there are Glensinnes primary school, Alta Bhainne Distillery and a small public hall. The primary school has 15 pupils and one teacher. The distillery was opened in 1975 employs 8 workers and is in full production making half a million gallons of whisky annually. The small hall (built as Dill Hall in 1883) is used by the public and by the school. There is sadly depopulation in the glen due almost entirely to bigger farm units by amalgamation of small farms.
